abstract.text: Initializes a checkerboard texture with the specified colors and other properties.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The number of squares along each dimension in the checkerboard pattern.
The
property for the new texture object.
The texel dimensions (width and height) of the texture image.
The number of channels per texel—for example, 1 for a grayscale texture, 3 for an RGB color texture, or 4 for RGBA.
The data format for each channel value per texel—for example, 8-bit integer or 32-bit floating point. For possible values, see
The color for half of the squares in the checkerboard pattern.
The color for the other half of the squares in the checkerboard pattern.
A new checkerboard texture object.
The
, and
parameters define the checkerboard pattern. For example, a
value of 2 creates a checkerboard pattern of four squares (a 2 x 2 grid), where the top left and bottom right squares use the
color and the other two squares use the
color. A value of 4 creates a pattern of 16 squares (a 4 x 4 grid), and so on.
This initializer does not generate texel data; the
class automatically generates data and caches it for reuse when you use one of the
methods listed in Accessing Texture Data. Changing the
, or
properties invalidates the cache, causing Model I/O to regenerate texel data the next time it is needed.

abstract.text: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
A generator of texel data that creates a checkerboard pattern with two specified colors.
The color for half of the squares in the checkerboard pattern.
The color for the other half of the squares in the checkerboard pattern.
The number of squares along each dimension in the checkerboard pattern.
Initializes a checkerboard texture with the specified colors and other properties.
A descriptive name for the object.
A source of texel data to be used in rendering material surface appearances.
The data format for each channel value per texel.
Options for the data size and type of texel channel values, used by the
A set of components that define a color, with a color space specifying how to interpret them.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
